post.summary: Deletes attributes from the given resource
Sets Attributes on the given resource
Creates a new Binding between a role, user(s) and resource(s)
Determines which policies were evaluated, and the resulting scopes available from each evaluation
Determines whether the caller has access to the given permissions for the given resource
Lists the callers available permissions for the given resource id

Determines whether the specified user has access to the given permissions for the given resource
Note: This RPC requires that the caller has permissions to check on behalf of the given user

PropertyPIITag.description:
PIITag defines potential PII tags.

 - PROPERTY_PII_TAG_CLEAN: clean means the data is not PII or PD.
 - PROPERTY_PII_TAG_PII: PII means Personally Identifiable Information. It is information that can be used to retrieve personal data, such as IAM user ID.
 - PROPERTY_PII_TAG_PD: PD means personal data, such as name, email and address. They are sensitive data we need to protect in our system.

ScopeConfigDenyAll.title: Indicates all scopes should be denied at this level

ScopeConfigGrantAll.title: Indicates all scopes should be granted at this level (other levels can override this)

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

displayName.title: The display name of the attribute set

v1AttributeSet.description:
An AttributeSet is a child of a Resource. It defines a Schema of a list of attributes that
can be added onto each individual resource.

id.description:
Id of the Attribute Set. This must be globally unique.

Follows the restful identifier semantics.

ÂµService naming would be: `application/brands` or might have additional components if necessary
Can optionally be provided, otherwise an id will be generated for you. Must be globally unique.

parentResource.title: The parent resource this binding is attached to

userId.title: The User ID this policy is associated to

matchingUsers.title: Matches resources by attributes on a resource

matchingResources.title: Matches resources by attributes on a resource

scopeConfig.title: Scopes being set by the binding

v1Binding.description: A Binding describes for a set of user(s) and set of resource(s), what set of permissions they have.

v1CreateAttributeSetRequest.title: Create Attribute Set with a set of fields and their schemas

resourceType.title: The resource type this resource will be created under

data.description:
The data of the resource. This information should only contain information necessary to evaluate the
registered policies.

schema.title: Schema of the properties on the resource type

resourceType.description: The resource type that this scope is associated with.

scopes.title: Set of scopes available to this resource

resource.title: The resource the Role is underneath

resourceType.description: The resource type that this scope is associated with.

evaluatedPolicy.title: The policy evaluated for this step

scopes.title: The set of scopes available for this requested resource at this particular evaluation step

v1EvaluationStepResult.title: EvaluationStepResult describes the resulting scopes available from a step in the policy evaluation process

resourceEvaluationResult.title: Evaluation result for each resource requested

v1ExplainUserHasAccessResponse.title: Response message for providing an explanation of why a user receives a HasAccess response result

filter.title: Matches resources by a specific criteria

v1FilterAttributes.title: FilterAttributes supports filtering on attributes of a resource

resource.title: The resource being requested access to

scopeIds.title: The scopes being requested access to

fieldMask.title: Controls which fields come back on the response

scopeIds.description:
Deprecated
The list of scopes ids that the caller has access to. If there were many resources requested, this represents
the union of available scopes across all requested resources.

unionScopes.description: The set of scopes that are available across all requested resources.

scopes.description: The set of scopes available for each requested resource.

v1HydratedResource.title: A resource that has been hydrated with attributes that were chosen

fieldMask.title: Controls which fields come back on the response

pageSize.title: Number of results to include in the response

cursor.description: The previous next_cursor from [ListPermissionsResponse], or "" if it is the first call.

nextCursor.title: To be provided to ListPermissions on a subsequent call to get the next page of results

resource.title: The resource id that this permission was granted for

v1Permission.title: The list of available scopes for the specified resource

userId.title: The User ID this policy is associated to

matchingResources.title:
Deprecated
Matches resources by attributes on a resource

scopeConfig.title: Scopes being set by the binding

bindingId.title: The id of the binding that this policy is within

v1Policy.title: Policy grants scopes to specific user(s) for a set of resources(s)

limit.title: The number of results to return

id.title:
ID of the resource. If the resource type was an AccountGroup, the Resource would be a specific
account group and the id would be /partner/ABC/accountGroup/AG-J7B4AP

v1Resource.description: Resource represents an instance of a ResourceType.

evaluatedPolicies.title: List of the policies that were evaluated for the given user

evaluationStepResults.title: List of the evaluation step results, in order of their evaluation

scopes.title: The final set of allowed scopes for this requested resource

v1ResourceEvaluationResult.title: ResourceEvaluationResult describes the result of each requested resource's evaluation

resourceSelector.title: Selects which resource types to filter

filterAttributes.title: The filter to narrow down the resources to

v1ResourceFilter.title: Filters resource by resource hierachy and attributes on the resources

v1ResourceKind.title:
- RESOURCE_KIND_RESOURCE: The default resource kind
 - RESOURCE_KIND_USER: Indicates the resource is a user

children.title: Selects the children of the specified resource types

v1ResourceSelector.title: ResourceSelector allows controlling which resource types to look at

name.description:
The full restful name of the resource type. For example an Account Group resource:
`/partner/*/accountGroup/*`.
See [Resource
Names](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/resource_names#full_resource_name)
for more information.

In the account group example, Account Group is a child resource of a Partner resource, and the Partner resource
must exist prior to being registered.

v1ResourceType.description:
ResourceType represents a resource type within the Vendasta platform. Examples are:
Partner, Market, Account Group, Executive Report, Product Activations, Brands, Products, Packages, etc...

id.title: Can optionally be provided, otherwise an ID will be generated for you

resource.title: The resource the Role is underneath

scopeConfig.title: Scopes being set by the role

id.title: Unique ID of the scope. For example: partner.accountGroup.editBusinessProfile

displayName.title: Display name of the scope. For example: Edit Business Profile

v1Scope.description:
Scope is associated to 1 or many resources. They describe an action that can be taken against that specific
resource. A scope can be granted by a higher resource level, if applicable.

canGrant.title: Indicates if the user is given rights to grant equal scopes to other users

v1SetAttributesRequest.title: Set Attributes attaches key-values to a resource (the attribute set must be created on the resource first)

data.title: Data to update (pieces of the id may not be updated)

schema.title: Schema of the properties on the resource type

resourceType.description: The resource type that this scope is associated with.

scopes.title: Set of scopes available to this resource

hasAccess.title: The request to make on behalf of the given user

paths.description: The set of field mask paths.

vendastatypesFieldMask.title: `FieldMask` represents a set of symbolic field paths, for example:

equal.description: Validates that a property matches a specific value.

operator.description: Combines multiple operations with AND or OR operators.

not.description: Not returns the opposite boolean value of the operator provided.

missing.description:
Matches results which are not missing a specific property. This will not match out items which have the
property set to a null value. The "null" operator can be used to match for properties which have null
values.

null.description:
Matches results which do not have the specified property set to the null value. This will also
include events that are missing the property entirely.

subset.description:
Items may include repeated values for a specific property. It may be useful to receive items which have
a property in the list.

For example, an item might have some attributes describing a category that looks like:
['Automotive', 'Car Dealers', 'Auto Repair']

Subscribers may only care about Auto Repair. In this case they can provide "Auto Repair" as the value to
only receive those events. If the Subscriber only wants events with "Auto Repair" and "Car Dealers"
the value can be defined as ['Auto Repair', 'Car Dealers']. If you wish to receive events where it's
"Auto Repair" OR "Car Dealers", you may use two subset operation and join them with an OR operator.

Order does not matter when checking if a list is a subset of an item's repeated property.

prefix.title: Validates that a property has a given prefix

name.title:
Unique identifier for this property. Must be in snake case format.
Example(s): account_group_id, listing_id, company_name

repeated.description: Indicates if the field is repeated.

properties.description:
Can only be specified if the Type supplied is a STRUCT.
Is the schema of the structured property.

vendastatypesProperty.title: Property defines a single property for a schema

vendastatypesSchema.title: Schema describes the structure of data in a storage-agnostic way
